channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: In Graphics | How do rare earths become magnets?
Why economic ties with 'bailout nation' Pakistan is a lose-lose for Bangladesh
How greying hair might actually be defending you against cancer
Trade, TikTok and war… What will Trump and Xi Jinping discuss at tomorrow’s big meet?
How Pakistani terrorist Masood Azhar is training the Jaish women's jihad brigade
How and why RBI is flying more of India's gold back home
The oasis that dreamt big: UAE as West Asia’s fulcrum of transformation
item.description: The missing link that many ascribe to the Islamic world’s relative backwardness remains the knowledge deficit in technology and modern-day intellectualism—the UAE overcomes that brilliantly and acts as the fulcrum around which transformation of the Arab world will take place

item.title: CCP’s 4th Plenum: How China’s focus on self-reliance, tech sovereignty could impact world
item.description: Beijing may adopt more aggressive state-led investments and regulations in the strategic sectors

item.title: Kuala Lumpur Summit: A defining milestone for the Indo-Asean century
item.description: With Asean Vision 2045 and Viksit Bharat 2047 aligned, India and Asean have embarked on a shared journey of prosperity, resilience, and stability

item.title: Between Trump and Xi: India’s strategic balancing in an uncertain global order
item.description: The erosion of global trust is forcing India to move from cautious optimism to strategic clarity in its foreign policy

item.title: For India-Middle East-Europe Economic Corridor to succeed, Delhi must invest more in Greece and Cyprus
item.description: If IMEEC is truly going to counter the Belt and Road Initiative, it must respond to the maritime advantages China has built over the last decade. Greece and Cyprus do that

item.title: Assam, its citizens and their never-ending search for 'citizenship'
item.description: As India revises its electoral rolls, Assam stands apart, still trapped between paperwork and belonging
